channel.title: Finding dates of days
channel.description:
This is kinda a challenge/task I want to see everyone complete because my solution is far from elegant.
I give you a day: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday... etc. (can be as a code) I give you a month: January, Feburary, March... etc (can be as a code) And a year.
Return an array of the date that the day falls on during that month in that year. eg:
Monday's in January 2013 fall on: {7,14,21,28 }. Wednesdays in Feb 2012 fell on {1,8,15,22,29}
You must be able to handle leap years too! GOGOGO

item.title: Finding dates of days
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Relevant

en.wikipedia.org

Determination of the day of the week

The determination of the day of the week for any date may be performed with a variety of algorithms. In addition, perpetual calendars require no calculation by the user, and are essentially lookup tables. A typical application is to calculate the day of the week on which someone was born or a specific event occurred. In numerical calculation, the days of the week are represented as weekday numbers. If Monday is the first day of the week, the days may be coded 1 to 7, for Monday through Sunday, ...

Read full topic

item.title: Finding dates of days
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Bowser jr:

How would the input be formatted?

When I wrote “(can be as a code)”, I meant January = 0, Feburary = 1, or Jan = 1, Feb = 2. It’s up to you, just state how you are formatting it.

Read full topic
